questions.question: Which of these is the best definition of a market-oriented business?

choices.answer: The firm does market research after launching a product
The firm produces a good that it believes will be successful
The firm does market research before designing a new product

questions.question: Which of the following questions is market research not likely to find an answer to?

choices.answer: Would consumers be likely to buy my product?
Which method of production should I use?
What price would consumers be likely to pay?
Which businesses will be the main competitors?

questions.question: Which of the following best defines primary market research?

choices.answer: It is data collection that always produces quantitative data
It uses information that has already been collected
It is also known as desk research
It gathers original data by contacting consumers directly

questions.question: One of the claimed advantages of primary data is that:

choices.answer: it is quick and easy to collect
it is usually up-to-date
it is always 100% accurate
it is cheap because it has already been collected

questions.question: One of the claimed advantages of secondary data is that:

choices.answer: it is always 100% accurate as the firm does the research
it is usually up-to-date
it is often cheap as the research has been done by others
it will not be available to rival businesses

questions.question: One possible advantage of questionnaires to gather primary data is that:

choices.answer: they are cheaper than all other forms of primary data
the response to surveys sentthrough email is always good
consumers can fill them in, in their own time & give detail

questions.question: In market research, a sample is defined as:

choices.answer: a trial of the product so that consumers can test it at home
a free gift to the consumer
all of the potential consumers of a product
a group selected from all of the potential product consumers

questions.question: Which is a reason for using a random sample of the population in market research?

choices.answer: It is more accurate than asking the whole population
It is more expensive than asking the whole population
It gives everyone an equal chance of being questioned

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of secondary data collection?

choices.answer: A traffic count to see how many vehicles passed by a shop
A postal questionnaire researching into consumer tastes
A newspaper report on the sales figures of a rival's product

questions.question: Which of the following will be likely to make a firm's market research more accurate?

choices.answer: A smaller sample to save costs
Greater use of secondary rather than primary data
Testing a questionnaire on a small group of consumers

questions.question: One of the claimed advantages of using interviews in primary market research is that:

choices.answer: the consumer answering the questions writes all the answers
there is no chance of interviewer bias
any questions that are unclear can be explained

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct when designing a questionnaire?

choices.answer: Keep the questions long and detailed
Avoid 'closed' questions
Ask 'leading' questions
Keep the questions short to ensure the survery is completed

questions.question: One of the advantages of using bar charts to record data is that:

choices.answer: they are eye-catching and the data can be easily understood
the use of pictures is very eye-catching and accurate
the graph shows the way in which the data changes over time

questions.question: The best way for a Sales Department to present figures from this year to compare with last year

choices.answer: is to present it as a line graph
is to present it as a pictogram
is to present it as a pie chart
is to present it as a tally chart

questions.question: The best way for a firm to show how the sales of five products contributed to total sales

choices.answer: is to present it as a line graph
is to present it as a pictogram
is to present it as a pie chart
is to present it as a tally chart

questions.question: Which data presentation would not be suitable for recording the number of cars passing a shop?

choices.answer: a line graph
a pictogram
a pie chart
a tally chart
